163510911-16351 -- Administrative Assistant, Sales and Use Tax

The Administrative Assistant uses experience and professionalism to support a team of Service Delivery professionals in their daily responsibilities. The position’s primary focus is to provide outstanding administrative support, while representing the Firm in a professional manner, maintaining a positive attitude and functioning as a team player.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Maintains communications (e-mail, written, phone, and fax) while team is traveling.
  • Tracks and reports time and expenses in detail for self and Manager as needed.
  • Makes travel arrangements for team members as needed.
  • Answers telephone calls and takes accurate and concise messages, escalating appropriately.
  • Maintains calendar appointments and deadlines to ensure proper accountability and client deadlines are observed.
  • Handles and safeguards confidential information and sensitive material.
  • Creates files, as needed, for clients and projects utilizing Microsoft® Excel and Access.
  • Utilizes strong grammar, spelling, and proofreading skills.
  • Organizes and prioritizes multiple tasks and completes them under time constraints.
  • Assists with other projects as needed.
  • Performs other duties as assigned.

Education and Experience:

High-school diploma or general equivalency diploma (GED) required with one to two years related administrative support experience.

Computer Skills:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must have intermediate knowledge of Microsoft® Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Internet navigation and research.

Certificates and Licenses:

Valid driver’s license required.

Supervisory Responsibilities:

This position has no supervisory responsibilities.

Work Environment:

  • Standard indoor working environment.
  • Occasional long periods of sitting while working at computer.
  • Occasional long periods of standing while copying.
  • Must be able to lift, carry, push, or pull up to 30 lbs.
  • Position requires regular interaction with employees at all levels of the Firm; interface with clients and external vendors as necessary.
  • Independent travel requirement: 0 to 10%.

fields.job_description:
[104915] - B2B Project Coordinator

Job Description

Position Summary
Plan, arrange, schedule, and coordinate domestic and international meetings, travel accommodations, appointments, meeting materials, and facilities. Prepare presentations and correspondence and act as point person for all phone/email inquiries.  Prepare and maintain division records, documents, expense reports, research materials, and files.  Maintain inventory of assigned property and equipment. Prepare executive personnel transaction documents, ensure access to company equipment and communications materials, and function as source to the executive for administrative information, forms, data, procedures, and records.  Incumbent is responsible for managing day-to-day process management of all activities and functions in a designated project, including proposal, development, evaluation, selection, and submission to management for review.  Incumbent would also be responsible for logistics of projects to include trade show and conferences (such as CTIA, CES, etc), internal and external customer service (B2B client executives), and interaction with the customer pertaining to new and ongoing projects within our group.

 
Common Essential Duties&Resp.

  • Maintains itineraries and schedules with specific attention to detail.  Identifies critical level of communications and the need for notification.  Interprets and clarifies requests and assists with required responses and action.  Provides counsel on miscellaneous project issues and the interpretation of administrative policies and procedures.  Prepares executive level reports, compiles data into comprehensible format, and provides information for the executive’s effective community, internal, external, and company headquarters communications.
  • Manage facilities as it pertains to office equipment, supplies, break room and any other general office needs for the B2B team.  Prepares and makes domestic and international travel and accommodation arrangements for employees.  Schedules and plans for meetings, events, and appointments.  Coordinates and provides accommodations, special travel needs, and hotel arrangements for executives and dispatchers.  Schedules conference rooms, maintains conference room equipment, and provides materials and supplies.  
  • The ability to plan, organize, and prioritize multiple assignments and projects, which include but are not limited to the following:  Review departmental monthly budget statements and analyze and track expenses to insure departmental expenditures are within stated boundaries.  Execute NDA’s, contracts, and agreements in a timely matter after evaluation and approval by the required parties. Review and monitor department and cell phone usage monthly to insure they are within the stated boundaries specified by the company.  Organize and coordinate headquarter meetings and logistics for executives and headquarter personnel.  Document weekly department staff meetings.
  • Conducts outbound dials to schedule CXO meetings with Named Accounts
  • Seed device inventory management and reporting
  • B2B budget reporting to include PUMI tracking, etc
  • Weekly P&L reporting to include sales revenue / volume, expenses, travel, etc
  • Sales Operations tasks to include Weekly/Monthly/Quarterly reporting
  • eContracts support to include submittals and daily tracking (NDAs from Named Accounts will become a sizable effort starting in Sept)
  • Work independently and in a team environment in order to achieve personal and team goals and complete assignments within established time frames.


 
Background / Experience

Background/Experience to qualify for this position, the following minimal background and skill levels are required:

  • A Bachelor’s degree with previous work experience in executive office administration, executive services, and applied secretarial skills and practices.
  • A minimum of 5-8 years experience in executive administrative support and/or project coordination.
  • Experience researching information and preparing company communications.  
  • Experience developing executive presentations using a variety of PC applications, including word processing, spreadsheet graphs and tables and PowerPoint.


 
Necessary Skills / Attributes
Necessary Skills/Attributes for this position the following skills and abilities must be demonstrated at a proficient level:

  • Develop and maintain excellent working relationships with all appropriate executive levels within the company, local community, and critical industry contacts.
  • Plan, organize, and prioritize multiple assignments and projects.
  • Read, write, prepare, and interpret executive materials, presentations, contracts, or related documents.
  • Demonstrated competency in both oral and written modes for internal and external personnel at all levels.  
  • Work independently and in a team environment in order to achieve personal and team goals and complete assignments within established time frames. The ability to perform tasks and work assignments based upon general policies where work results are sometimes monitored.  Detail and analysis is required to make decisions and to determine appropriate courses of action where situations differ and require creativity to search for solutions among business strategies, established policies, and objectives.

Job Description:

Seeking SAP HCM Talent for direct-hire opportunities at Top-Tier Consulting Firm!

 

Our client is a US-based, top-tier Consulting firm – when you join their team, you can make great ideas happen for some of the world's most dynamic companies. With broad global resources and deep technical know-how, they collaborate with clients to cultivate ideas and deliver results. Choose a career at a Tier One Firm and enjoy an innovative environment where challenging and interesting work is part of daily life.

 

NO SPONSORSHIP OR 3RD PARTY – must be able to travel and can be based in Boston, Hartford, New York, New Jersey, Philadelphia, Pittsburgh, Cleveland, Cincinnati, Detroit, Chicago, Kansas City, St. Louis, Kansas City, Raleigh, Charlotte, Atlanta, Tampa, Dallas, Austin, Houston, Denver, Phoenix, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Sacramento, San Jose or Seattle.


Our client’s Consulting workforce is involved in business consulting, process design work and the application of technologies to business. A career in Consulting is varied and stimulating because each project presents a new challenge and will give you exposure to new clients, business issues, technologies and people. They need people who are able to challenge conventional thought, offer unique perspectives and conceive more innovative solutions for our clients.



Working as a consultant, you will build core business, technology and industry expertise helping to deliver world-class business and technology solutions that enable clients to become high performance businesses.  Consultants must be professionals who have an interest in how business processes work and interact.  In addition, consultants need to apply their skills in project and program management while exhibiting leadership in process re-engineering and implementation of process, technology, and organizational change.  Finally, consultants also need to have a working knowledge of the industry and/or the functional areas they serve. 

 

Our clients SAP professionals are responsible for delivering large-scale, complex programs that marry processes with technology to help clients achieve high performance.  SAP professionals have skills in delivering SAP enterprise solutions. The focus is on architecting a solution using SAP to achieve a defined business outcome.

Key Responsibilities will include: 

  • Design and configure applications                       
  • Participate in the gathering of functional requirements                        
  • Document design decisions                        
  • Configure SAP within HR modules                        
  • Document configuration rationale                        
  • Resolve related issues                        
  • Prototype the solution for the client

Qualifications will include:

  • Bachelors degree with 1+ full SAP lifecycle implementation within HR
  • Strong hands-on configuration
  • Strong client facing skills with previous consulting experience
  • Able to travel as needed (usually Monday-Thursday)

Email confidential resume in Word to Caroline O’Connor, coconnor@mmcgrp.com , type ATTN: SAP HCM in the subject line of email

The ideal candidate must have a good understanding of online advertising/ marketing. They must have the ability to complete the sales cycle from inception to completion - - including prospecting, developing client relationships, preparing proposals, tracking the information on a sales database.

DallasBlack.com
RedeemKing.com (Deal Site)

- Build and maintain client relationship through on-the-street prospecting, cold calling and on-going service calls

- Work with individual clients in determining, then fulfilling their advertising needs
- Track a variety of data accurately
- Responsible for customer satisfaction, as well as sales and profit objectives
- Ability to attend networking functions
- Ability to meet set sales goals

REQUIREMENTS:

- At least one (1) year of sales experience
- General knowledge of Internet usage and Research
- Above Average Follow Up Skills
- High energy level and a willingness to learn
- Ability to deal effectively with all types of personalities
- Above average initiative, creativity, negotiation and listening skills
- Motivated self-starter that is very customer service oriented with a professional appearance-
- Reliable transportation
- Strong Verbal Written Skills

- Bonus opportunities

Lot Agents-3 (Choice)


Responsibilities
Responsible for monitoring car supply and cleanliness; maintaining adequate car model mixes; providing customer serviceby directing customers to assigned vehicle and assisting with car lot exit process, and communicating with various employee groups regarding fleet availability. 

RESPONSIBILITIES/ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: % TIME 
1. Monitor car supply and cleanliness, maintain adequate model mixes to meet demand and ensure efficiency in the rental process; ensure security of vehicles and placement on lot is accurate. 45% 

2. Provide customer service by directing customers to assigned vehicles, assisting with vehicle upgrades and/or exchanges, and receive and respond to customer complaints using the PONA (Pass of Non Adjustment) process and direct customer complaints/issues to supervisor, if necessary. 
25% 

3. Assist with car lot exit process by checking customer identification, rental agreement paperwork and vehicle asset number tags to ensure appropriate and timely exit/movement. 10% 

4. Communicate and coordinate with management, RSAs and Expedited Gate Agent regarding fleet availability; coordinate vehicle wait situations as necessary. 10% 

5. Receive and enter change of car status and grounding dates into computer system; research and complete non-revenue entries. 5% 

6. Distribute new car keys for customers and employees. 5% 

Perform related responsibilities as required or assigned. 
Qualifications
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS: 
Knowledge and Skill 
• Knowledge of car rental operation 
• Knowledge and skill in the operation of car rental software and hardware 
• Ability to type and perform accurate data entry 
• Good organizational skills with the ability to write clearly and concisely 
• Ability to understand and follow oral and written directions 
• Ability to process all paperwork according to policies and procedures 
• Ability to manage stressful and unusual situations while maintaining good customer relation 
• Ability to speak and understand English 
• Ability to operate radio, security and computer equipment. 

Required Education/Experience 
• High School Diploma or equivalent 
• At least 1 year customer service experience 
• 1 year of car rental experience preferred. 
• Valid driver's license as required by State 
DTAG Marketing Statement
Dollar Thrifty Automotive Group, Inc., a Fortune 1000 company and leader in the rental car industry, has its corporate headquarters in Tulsa, OK. We respect and value our employees, and recognize that they are the key to our success. We strive to provide a positive work environment and recognize and celebrate our achievements. 
Benefits
Dollar Thrifty Automotive Group, Inc. Employee Benefit Plan provides a very comprehensive and industry-competitive health care benefit package to employees including medical, dental, vision, basic life insurance, accidental death and dismemberment insurance, supplemental life insurance, as well as short term and long term disability insurance. 

The Plan also provides for a Health Flexible Spending Account and a Dependent Flexible Spending Account. In addition to the benefits described above, Dollar Thrifty also offers a 401(k) Retirement Savings Program that includes an employer match. 

The Dollar Thrifty Employee Benefit Plan allows you the flexibility to elect benefits that best fit your individual and family needs. 
Equal Employment Opportunity
Dollar Thrifty Automotive Group, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and will not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religious creed, national origin, ancestry, age, gender, disability, medical condition or marital status or other protected status. 
Closing Statement
Thank you for your interest in Dollar Thrifty Automotive Group, Inc. We appreciate your visit to our Career Site. If you have interest and would like to be considered for any of our career opportunities, please apply on-line.

Realistic Job Preview (RJP)

FRISCO VETERANS CAREER FAIR TO BE HELD APRIL 4

(March 28, 2012) Veterans looking for work -- or interested in making a 
career change -- are invited to attend the Veterans Career Fair on 
Wednesday, April 4.  The inaugural ‘come and go’ event for veterans, only, 
will be held at the Frisco Discovery Center, 8004 North Dallas Parkway, 
from 10 a.m. – 2 p.m. Proof of military service is required to 
participate.

Representatives from more than 30 companies and organizations will be on 
site at the job fair, hosted by the City of Frisco and the Mayor’s 
Veterans’ Advisory Committee.  Fees and donations collected from 
participating companies will benefit the Frisco VFW Post 8273, which is 
working to establish the Veterans Walk of Honor in Frisco Commons Park.

“We want to do all we can to help our veterans find job opportunities,” 
said Mayor Maher Maso.  “We owe our gratitude to the men and women who 
have served our country to protect our liberties. Here in Frisco, we also 
want to do our part to help introduce companies to this highly trained and 
dedicated pool of job candidates.”

Information released earlier this month by the U.S. Bureau of Labor 
Statistics reports the unemployment rate for veterans who served on active 
duty in the U.S. Armed Forces at any time since September 2001 was 12.1 
percent in 2011.  The bureau also cites the jobless rate for all veterans 
was 8.3 percent last year.

“Veterans are encouraged to bring their resumes -- and plenty of them,” 
said Lee Myrben, Frisco Veterans Advisory Committee.  “If you’re a veteran 
and you don’t have a resume, or your resume needs updating, we can help 
with that, too,” said Myrben, adding that representatives from the Texas 
Workforce Commission will be assisting veterans with creating resumes.

Worldlink, Inc. will also be providing tips on how to write cover letters, 
dress for success and do well during interviews.

Other participating companies and organizations include:  A#1Air Inc., 
Acuity Training Systems, Inc., Allies in Service, American Legion, AT&T, 
Baylor Institute for Rehabilitation, BB&T, Cintas, Code Authority, Inc., 
Con-Way, Core Concept Communications, Dallas Air Motive, Dr. Options, Dr 
Pepper Snapple Group, Ericsson, Extend Health, Iraq&Afghanistan Veterans 
of America, Jet Pay Merchant, Kaplan College, Lennox International, Frisco 
ISD, Mario Sinacola & Sons, Medical Center of Plano, Statewide Remodeling, 
Technisource, Texas Instruments, ThyssennKrupp, University of Phoenix and 
VOLT.

The job fair is also supported by partnerships with PRISMA Staffing, the 
Frisco Economic Development Corporation, the Frisco Community Development 
Corporation and the Frisco Chamber of Commerce.

Senior Microsoft Systems Administrator

Make a Difference 
Senior Microsoft Systems Administrator, Richardson TX 

Founded in 1944, Parsons, an engineering, construction, technical, and management services firm with revenues of $2.7 billion in 2011, is 100% owned by the Employee Stock Ownership Trust. We conquer the toughest logistical challenges and deliver design/design-build, program/construction management, professional services, and innovative alternative delivery solutions to private industrial customers worldwide as well as to federal, regional, and local government agencies. Parsons is a leader in many diversified markets with a focus on infrastructure, environmental, and defense/security. Currently, more than 11,000 Parsons' employees are engaged in more than 4,500 projects in 50 states and 26 countries. These dedicated workers speak 89 languages collectively, and hold more than 10,300 college degrees and professional registrations. Parsons' employees continue to go anywhere in the world, meet every technical and management challenge, and persevere until the job is done. 

POSITION OVERVIEW: 
The IT Infrastructure Specialist provides advanced system configuration administrative functions for the Enterprise IT infrastructure, including monitoring and tuning as well as resolving service incidents. Responsible for the design, installation and integration of IT Infrastructure throughout the Enterprise (Microsoft Server OS, servers, storage, etc.). May provide supplemental support in designing and implementing Enterprise-wide strategic infrastructure solutions. 

Provides operational support for small to medium-sized IT Infrastructure projects and systems for Parsons, individual projects and GBUs. Executes the technical aspects of moderately complex and small infrastructure projects from concept and scoping through design and implementation; validates the delivered system to ensure that the project adheres to technical and quality standards. Evaluates systems currently in use to assess their effectiveness, to determine how well the infrastructure elements are meeting current and projected business needs and to recommend efficiencies, upgrades and modifications that will improve system use.

Qualifications:
Preferred Education/Experience: 
4-year degree in Computer Science (or related curriculum) and 8-10 years of diversified experience working in more than one area of infrastructure technology (network, servers, storage, desktop, IPTelephony). Experience maintaining one or more infrastructure elements for a large global enterprise. Experience working as a member of a diverse, geographically based team involved in project delivery from concept, scoping, design through to implementation. Individuals with a 2-year degree and an additional 3 years of relevant experience can be considered. Those candidates without a degree will be required to have an additional 5 years of relevant experience for consideration. Must be capable of performing heavy lifting associated with server installs.

Certifications: 
Microsoft Certified IT Professional (MCITP-Enterprise Administrator) required. 
Additional advanced certifications relevant to the Parsons Infrastructure environment (e.g., ITIL v3 Foundation, VMware Certified Professional-VCP, Citrix CCA, Cisco Associate Certifications (CCNA, CCNA Voice, CCNA Security, etc.), NetApp NCDA and NCIE, Certified CommVault Engineer, etc.) preferred. 

SKILLS/COMPETENCIES: 
Understanding of Infrastructure components and protocols and how they fit into an enterprise architecture, including network, TCP/IP protocols, servers (Dell/Cisco UCS), various enterprise operating systems (Microsoft Server and desktop OS, Linux), virtualization (VMware/Hyper-V), Network Attached Storage (NetApp), Citrix, Active Directory, databases, infrastructure enabling protocols and various network/application protocols. 

Required skills relating to Data Security, Management and Backup include: Exposure to Backup methodologies and technologies, Disaster recovery techniques and planning; Knowledge of media handling and care; Disaster recovery techniques and planning; Data restoration and verification and Database backup methods and management. 

Parsons offers an ethical, challenging, diverse, rewarding and fun work experience where enthusiastic, responsible people use their energy, talent and dedication to make a difference in the world. 

We provide career growth and development, a competitive compensation and benefits package which includes medical, dental, vision, and life insurance; tuition reimbursement program; credit union membership; Employee Stock Ownership Plan and a 401(k) plan. Parsons is an equal opportunity, drug-free employer committed to diversity in the workplace. M/W/D/V.

Position: Senior Broadcast Technology Analyst

Location:Dallas,TX

Duration:Full Time

Title: Senior Broadcast Technology Analyst

Job Description:

 

This person will be considered a hybrid technologist between broadcast engineering and IT. They will be analyzing infrastructure design, specifically as it relates to post production activities including editing technologies, infrastructures, system integrations, workflows, best practices, and using their expertise to objectively analyze the requirements of the clients to existing infrastructures with recommendations for upgrades, enhancements and changes to optimize the direction of the client.  This person will also be responsible for testing software and hardware configurations and be able to develop test scripts based on functionality required. This will be specific to all applications portfolio creation, but primarily around Final Cut Pro, additional applications within the Final Cut Suite, but also related to ancillary motion graphics or creative packages as might be required within the client preferences. This will also include transcoding

requirements across multi-screen distribution and codec analysis within transcoding engines, both existing and future. This will require written documentation including diagrams of networks in an As-Is and To-Be snapshot as to a roadmap with logical approaches in terms of achieving the client’s goals. 

Responsibilities:

Reporting to the client manager/supervisor, this person will be working alongside client resources and piers as a team to elicit a comprehensive landscape of the infrastructures and application portfolio. This will require responsibility for objective analysis of current infrastructure, applications, workflows, and key resource responsibilities. This will include detailed documentation of those analyses, diagrams of existing networks and server configurations, systems setup/configuration, editing workstation setup/configurations, applications portfolios, workflows, responsibilities and systems integrations.  Also responsible for writing and executing test scripts with regard to the required functionality and documenting test results for enhancements. Included will be distribution outputs related to automated transcoding engines as may exist or required for future implementation. This will require using best practices to define an optimum state for the

client given requirements that may also need original or further definition.

Qualifications:  

Experience in the technical aspects of broadcasting, preferably working in a Studio or Broadcast post production environment. In depth understanding of digital video systems, video compression technologies such as, but not limited to MPEG, MPEG-4, AVCHD, H.264, etc. Experience in IP protocols, all streaming media formats including Flash, HLS, HTML5 along with digital rights management. Experience with ingestion and transcoding software such as Pipeline, Agility, Episode, FlipFactory, Rhozet, Anystream, etc. Experienced in QA testing, script execution and documentation of results in a post production environment. Expert level of understanding of MPEG analysis, understanding GOP structure, bit rates, file size analysis, aspect ratios, anamorphic versus standard compressions using applications such as Cerify and Manzanita.Experience with Final Cut Pro Studio, current and past versions, plus the Adobe Creative Suite, version 3 through the latest.

Human Resources Manager
Location: Dallas, TX

Oversees the administration and development of Human Resources functions and services for US operations of a global logistics company.

Responsibilities:
Benefits Management ? Oversees the administration of all benefit programs. Evaluates and monitors benefit programs and makes recommendations to improve quality of service and contain costs. Works with Broker to manage annual benefits renewal and manages the annual open enrollment.
Staffing ? Works with management to acquire talent for the organization. Develops and maintains relationships and agreements with external vendors to source candidates.
Payroll Management ? Manages employee change transaction process and oversees multi-state payroll to include timekeeping, processing, tax filings, garnishments, and regulatory and legal compliance.
Performance Management ? Oversees the performance management process to include annual review activities and support of on-going performance feedback utilizing Employee Performance Management System.
Compensation Management ? Oversees compensation administration by managing the annual merit and bonus process. Utilizes survey data and internal information to guide management concerning compensation decisions.
Training and Development ? Conducts or sources professional development training for employees and management
Legal Compliance ? Ensures that all governmental reporting is performed in a timely and accurate manner for areas of oversight including, benefits, compensation, EEO. Stays abreast of legal environment to ensure that company practices are in alignment with applicable state and federal laws, (e.g. FMLA, ADA, EEO, ERISA, etc. )

Education&Experience:
? Bachelors Degree required
? 5 years experience in Human Resources in a generalist capacity to include specific experience in payroll, benefits, and compensation.
? Strong organizational and multi-tasking skills required.
? Excellent customer service skills.
? Experience handling sensitive, confidential information.
? Experience with HRIS systems and implementation.
? Experience with various Compensation programs

If you are interested and qualified, please send a "Word" copy of your resume/CV and salary requirements to the address below. When applying, please indicate the job and the location in the subject line of your e-mail.

Jericho HR Group

Accounts Payable/Receivable - Lewisville, TX

We are seeking an administrative professional who can provide reception and general office coverage and process accounts payable and receivable transactions. Must be a quickbooks expert!

Duties:

* Prepares work to be accomplished by gathering and sorting documents and related information.

* Pays invoices by verifying transaction information; scheduling and preparing disbursements; obtaining authorization of payment.

* Obtains revenue by verifying transaction information; computing charges and refunds; preparing and mailing invoices; identifying delinquent accounts and insufficient payments.

* Collects revenue by reminding delinquent accounts; notifying customers of insufficient payments.

* Prepares financial reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing account information and trends.

* Maintains accounting ledgers by posting account transactions.

* Verifies accounts by reconciling statements and transactions.

Skills/Qualifications:

Administrative Writing Skills, Organization, Data Entry Skills, General Math Skills, Analyzing Information , Attention to Detail, Thoroughness, Reporting Research Results, Verbal Communication

Billing Specialist Dallas, TX

Duties:
* Receives orders by calling for voice messages; sorting faxes and e-mails; bursting orders; calculating totals; organizing documents for entry.
* Enters orders by inputting data into the SAGE system; verifying addresses; flagging for price, promotion, and credit-limit problems.
* Forwards orders by routing orders.
* Prepares invoices by calculating charges; making necessary cuts; entering release numbers and shipping dates into database; placing orders in ready status; ordering invoices from computer invoicing system; mailing invoices.
* Generates credit memos by ordering memos from computer credit system.
* Accomplishes accounting and organization mission by completing related results as needed.
*Other office duties are required as assigned.

Data Entry Skills, Organization, Attention to Detail, General Math Skills, Productivity, Independence, Telephone Skills, Word Processing , Documentation Skills, Dependability, Reporting Research Results

Legal Secretary Addison, TX FAMILY LAW/LITIGATION
5+ years of law firm legal secretarial experience needed in a litigation-based Family Law practice group.  This “super star” secretary must be multi-task oriented with strong secretarial, organizational and communication skills needed for this fast-paced position.  Requires strong proofreading and transcription skills, knowledge of all phases of litigation; family law experience highly preferred!  Must enjoy the fast pace, client interaction and must be able to work overtime as needed with minimal notice.  Proficient in Word 2007, WordPerfect X3 and X4, time entry; typing 75+ wpm, e-filing.

Searching for a Corporate Controller - Manufacturing experience a must. Base to $140K + bonus. Please email me at vira@virtussearchpartners.com.

15+ years experience with a strong understanding of manufacturing and costing. Great opportunity with company that is in high growth mode.

Summary of Responsibilities:

The strategic intent of this role is to drive profitable growth within the direct-to-consumer business.  This person is responsible for developing and implementing innovative financial products or services designed to grow revenue.  Once the new products have been implemented, the incumbent is responsible for the management of the product.

 

Essential Functions:

 

  • Provides thought leadership to guide and support well-reasoned decisions in matters of strategy and business development.
  • Plans and manages the development of new product capabilities, defines respective user requirements and management of new products and also provides the vision to other support areas within the organization, such as IT and marketing.
  • Collaborates with decision makers in marketing, operations, IT to ensure that their products are appropriately commercialized.
  • Creates and maintains business plan for the markets served by the product portfolio.
  • Product marketing and product management.

 

Other Functions:

 

  • Sets direction for strategic development and relationship management.
  • Negotiate contracts and terms with applicable partners/merchants.
  • Monitor industry trends and provide subject matter expertise to existing portfolios and business development opportunities for all aspects of operations.  To support new business opportunities and clearly articulate SCUSA’s competitive capabilities.
  • Direct the activities related to the execution of the strategic business initiatives designed to enhance the product market position against competitors.
  • Special projects as requested.
  • Performs other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:

Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in business, marketing, economics, or a related field; advanced degree in relevant field preferred.
  • Exceptional analytical skills to critically evaluate internal and external industry trends, data and information and possess the ability to decompose high-level information into details.
  • Have an excellent understanding of the operational, reputational and legal risks associated with the various direct-to-consumer marketing channels, including, but not limited to: ecommerce, direct mail, etc.
  • Understand, follow and demonstrate compliance with all relevant internal and external rules, regulations and procedures that apply to the coordination of their respective business.
  • Strong interpersonal skills to help negotiate priorities and resolve conflicts amongst stakeholders.
  • Superior MS Excel and modeling skills.
  • Four (4) to seven (7) years experience in the financial services industry required; auto-finance experience and/or consumer finance experience preferred.

Requirements

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Strong analytical, problem solving, prioritization, organizational and communication/interpersonal skills.
  • Three (3) or more years experience leading projects of a strategic nature, preferably within Consumer Finance.
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality.

 

Working Conditions:

 

  • Extended work hours may be required as dictated by management and business needs.
  • Travel to multiple facilities may be required.
Apply below.
